Translation of: Asterix en de waarheid.

131.heading: Vehicles.

notes: "From Metal Hurlant," cf. contents page.
"Our story so far: Jerry Cornelius had a garage that held all his vehicles, but, but the garage was airtight! Alas!"
"To be continued."

139.heading: Vehicles.
139.title: "Low Tide"
139.author: by Ever Meulen
139.appears_in: p. 54 in The New Yorker, v. 77, no. 19 (July 16, 2001).
notes: Full-page panel of a dry ocean floor with ships, and land vehicles, some stranded.

140.heading: Vehicles.
140.title: "Pilgrims"
140.author: Alfonso Azpiri
notes: Summary: Lorna's robot is trying to fix their vehicle when three little pilgrims, whose eyes are always directed towards heaven, offer to help. They fix the vehicle and attend to Lorna's needs. Lorna then crashes the vehicle beyond repair. The robot begins constructing a raft by a river, while Lorna goes swimming. The robot is concerned when a large school of fish approaches Lorna, but it turns out they like her. The enthusiastic thrusting of the fish works to propel their raft.

141.heading: Vehicles.
141.title: "Sample" 5 p. in Carapaces
141.author: Luc & François Schuiten (Hollywood, CA : Humanoids Publishing, 2001).
notes: Summary: A human is sucked from his horse through a setting of tall forest trees into a hovering vehicle. The vehicle has an insect-like shape.

Plates numbered 15-30.
